title: Show Me The City
deployedtitle: See Show Me The City in Action
githubtitle: Show Me The City GitHub Repo
description: A full-stack React application built by a team of 4 for users to explore things to do in a city. Uses MongoDB for storing data, Firebase for user authentication, and Node.js & Express.js to create RESTful API.  My role was to complete the front-end styling using Styled-Components to bring teammates Figma design to life.

title: My Media Mate
description: A full-stack media review application built by a team of 4 using a Model View Controller architecture. Used MySQL database with Sequelize Object-Relational Mapping. Handlebars were used for front-end templating.  My role was creating the controllers and routes to ensure our front end connected properly to our DB.

title: MVC Tech Blog
description: Full-stack CMS-style blog site. The app follows the MVC paradigm in its architectural structure, uses Handlebars.js as the templating language, Sequelize as the ORM, and the express-session npm package for user authentication. Created a Glassmorphism UI design using CSS.

title: Employee Directory
description: React application that uses a random-user API to simulate a searchable directory of employees.

title: Weather Application
description: Used the OpenWeather API to retrieve weather data for cities and dynamically render HTML and CSS in the browser. Used localStorage to store persistent data about previously searched cities.

title: Work Day Scheduler
description: Calendar application that allows a user to save events for each hour of the day. This app runs in the browser and features dynamically updated HTML and CSS powered by jQuery. Utilized Moment.js library to work with date and time.

title: Note Taker
description: A note-taker application that uses an Express.js back end to save and retrieve note data from a JSON file.

title: README Generator
description: This is a command-line application that dynamically generates a professional README.md file from a user's input using the Inquirer package. This was my introduction to the power of Node.js.

title: JavaScript Quiz
description: One of my very first projects using Javascript was creating a timed JS quiz created with Vanilla JS logic to dynamically render HTML and CSS.  Uses local storage to record High Scores.

title: Password Generator
description: Javascript browser application that generates a random password based on user-selected criteria. This project was an exercise in fundamental Javascript concepts and in utilizing vanilla Javascript.

title: Fitness Tracker
description: Given front-end starter code, created the back-end Mongo database with a Mongoose schema and handled routes with Express.js to create a fitness tracker application.

title: Budget Tracker
description: This project is a Budget Tracker application that allows for offline access and functionality. The user can add expenses and deposits to their budget with or without an internet connection.
